Authors:
Kevin D Hyde, Asha Dissanayake , Wei Zhang , Xinghong Li ,
Yue Xie , Ying Zhou , Xiao Liu , Ekachai Chukeatirote, Jiye Yan, Guozhen
Zhang , Wensheng Zhao
Title:
First record and pathogenicity of Neofusicoccum mangiferae
associated with Grapevine dieback in China
Keywords:
Neofusicoccum mangiferae, Botryosphaeriaceae, wood canker,
Vitis vinifera, pathogenicity
Abstract:
The Botryosphaeriaceae represents an important,
cosmopolitan family of pathogens infecting woody plants. Grapevines
(Vitis vinifera) which are suspected of being infected with
Botryosphaeriaceae dieback were collected from different Provinces of
China and several Botryosphaeriaceae species were identified. This
research was conducted to further study the species of
Botryosphaeriaceae associated with grapvines in China, to estimate the
prevalence and severity of the disease. Symptoms were characterized by
the presence of the partial or total death of the grapevine cordons with
brown V-shaped or U-shaped cankers and black spots in cross-sections of
the bark. Pathogenic isolates obtained from symptomatic tissues from
vineyards in Henan and Anhui Provinces were identified to be
Neofusicoccum mangiferae Syd. & P. Syd. (teleomorph Botryosphaeria
sp.), on the basis of morphological and cultural characteristics as well
as analysis of sequence data from internal transcribed spacers (ITS),
β-tubulin (Bt) and elongation factor (EF1-α) gene regions. Pathogenicity
was verified by inoculation of excised detached green grapevine shoots
and mature wood of standing vines from cv. Summer Black under controlled
laboratory conditions. This is the first isolation and identification of
N. mangiferae associated with grapevine dieback in the world.
